titles.title: To amend the boundaries of the Flower Garden Banks National Marine Sanctuary.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E217)
Referred to the House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries.

committee.name: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Oceanography, Gulf of Mexico, and the Outer Continental Shelf.

committee.name: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries
House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries
committee.subcommittee: Oceanography, Gulf of Mexico, and the Outer Continental Shelf

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries
committee.subcommittee: Oceanography, Gulf of Mexico, and the Outer Continental Shelf

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee.

committee.name: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries. H. Rept. 103-441.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 244.

action.text: Mr. Studds moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce.

committee.name: House Merchant Marine and Fisheries
committee.subcommittee: Oceanography, Gulf of Mexico and the Outer Continental Shelf

bill.summary: 3/21/1994--Passed House amended. Modifies the boundaries of the Flower Garden Banks National Marine Sanctuary to include an area popularly known as Stetson Bank. Directs the Secretary of the Navy to transfer funds to the Administrator of the Maritime Administration for the conversion of the USNS Chauvenet to a training ship for the Texas Maritime Academy's Training Program.
